Bart Winiarski

Bartosz 'Bart' Winiarski · bart@winiarski.me

Welcome to the crossroads where engineering precision meets software innovation !

I'm a seasoned Mechanical Engineer specialized in Aerospace Engineering, with over 12 years of immersive experience in the aviation industry, standing at an exciting new juncture pivoting my career towards the dynamic world of Java development as a full stack developer!

Projects

mydojo.pl

Backend + Frontend

The MyDojo application, encompassing a powerful Java Spring Boot backend and a React-based frontend, represents a harmonious blend of technical robustness and user-centric design. Current version lays a promising foundation for a scalable, secure, and efficient management tool tailored to the unique demands of martial arts school administration.

Experience

Principal Design Engineer

Collins Aerospace, Wrocław, Poland

As a Principal Design Engineer my tenure has been marked by significant contributions and leadership in the field of mechanical design. I co-authored a critical functional tolerance analysis for the CH-53K Cargo bay's restraint and actuation subsystem, showcasing my expertise in complex system analysis and GD&T over a challenging six-month period. My role expanded to include leading a pioneering project for a Next Generation Boom Rotary Actuator for helicopter rescue hoists, advancing it to TRL 3, and spearheading a quality analysis project for an airplane cargo handling device, all while providing technical guidance to a team of up to five engineers and shaping internal design processes.

February 2019 - Present

Student Air Traffic Controller

Polish Air Navigation Agency, Warsaw, Poland

My experience in role of Student Air Traffic Controller was not just a job, but a unique and exceptional journey that demanded a rare blend of specific personal traits and professional qualifications. Successfully navigating a rigorous multi-stage recruitment process, I demonstrated innate qualities essential for this high-stakes profession: keen perceptiveness, unshakeable calmness, strategic planning, decisive judgment, assertiveness, and the ability to collaborate seamlessly in a team setting. My training encompassed an intensive basic course for the Student Air Traffic Controller license, coupled with specialized simulator training for Area Control endorsement in Polish airspace. This role exemplified a distinctive blend of mental agility, technical skill, and unwavering commitment to safety and precision in the critical field of air traffic control.

November 2017 - January 2019

Design Engineer

UTC Aerospace Systems, Wrocław, Poland

During my tenure as a Design Engineer I significantly honed my expertise in aircraft component design. This role saw me lead the development of angle bevel gearboxes, adhering to AGMA standards right from conceptualization to detailed design creating precise 3D CAD models and 2D drawings, coupled with detailed GD&T analysis. I was instrumental in designing test fixtures and actively collaborated with customers to ensure that all requirements and expectations were met, showcasing my technical skills and customer-centric approach in a high-stakes aerospace environment.

December 2013 - November 2017

Junior Design Engineer

Sikorsky Aircraft Corporation, Mielec, Poland

My professional journey began as a Junior Design Engineer at PZL Mielec, a Sikorsky Company, marking the start of a thrilling adventure in the world of aviation. This role was more than just an introduction to the industry; it was an opportunity to contribute to the legacy of two iconic aircraft - the S70i "Black Hawk" helicopter and the Polish M28 "Bryza" airplane.

June 2012 - December 2013

Interests

Outside of my professional life, I am deeply passionate about two physically and mentally demanding activities: long-distance cycling and practicing full-contact Kyokushin Karate.

Cycling for me is not just a hobby; it's a pursuit of endurance and resilience. I am an avid participant in ultramarathon cycling events, taking on formidable challenges like 1200 km rides which I aim to complete within 120 hours . These grueling rides are not just tests of physical stamina but also mental fortitude, teaching me lessons in persistence, planning, and pushing beyond perceived limits. The thrill of conquering such distances on a bike brings a sense of accomplishment that parallels the complexities and triumphs of my professional life. To bring this aspect of my life closer to those who share a similar zeal or are simply curious about the world of ultramarathon cycling, I've taken to documenting my adventures on my YouTube channel, "Wąsy na Szutrze" .
